pr_title: Refactor array_agg, string_agg and count functions to use new function registry.

timeline.message: Refactor count function to use new function registry.
Refactor array_agg function to use new function registry.
Refactor string_agg function to use new function registry.
Refactor string_agg function to use new function registry.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe worth creating builder shortcuts like Signature.scalar() also for aggregates? I think this really improves readability. Also note the signature.withTypeVariableContraints() builder.
timeline.author: seut

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/execution/engine/aggregation/impl/ArrayAgg.java b/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/execution/engine/aggregation/impl/ArrayAgg.java
index 88d0772f04..d5dae50f58 100644
--- a/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/execution/engine/aggregation/impl/ArrayAgg.java
+++ b/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/execution/engine/aggregation/impl/ArrayAgg.java

@@ -49,13 +49,11 @@ public final class ArrayAgg extends AggregationFunction<List<Object>, List<Objec
 
     public static void register(AggregationImplModule module) {
         module.register(
-            Signature.builder()
-                .name(NAME)
-                .kind(FunctionInfo.Type.AGGREGATE)
-                .argumentTypes(parseTypeSignature("E"))
-                .typeVariableConstraints(typeVariable("E"))
-                .returnType(parseTypeSignature("array(E)"))
-                .build(),
+            Signature.aggregate(
+                NAME,
+                parseTypeSignature("E"),
+                parseTypeSignature("array(E)")
+            ).withTypeVariableConstraints(typeVariable("E")),
             args -> new ArrayAgg(args.get(0))
         );
     }
